intro: Psoralea harveyana, commonly known as Harvey's psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has small, pinnate leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
